title: How much does a 55-gallon drum of water weigh? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, what is the volume of a [math]\text{US gallon}[/math] of water in Kosher units….? [math]\text{1 US gallon} \equiv 3.785•L[/math] And so we got a volume of [math]\text{55 US gallon}×3.785•L•\text{US gallon}^{-1}=208.2•L[/math] And since ONE LITRE of water has a mass of [math]1•kg[/math], we gots a mass of [math]208.2•kg[/math] with respect to water, plus whatever the mass of the barrel was….
8.32 pounds time 55 = 457.6 pounds = the unspecified wight of the barrel … assuming the water is not super hot/cold and is EXACTLY 55 gallons …
